mainWorks.title: MAN IN THE MIRROR
mainWorks.shortDescription: Will be presented as a work in progress at Hoffestspiele 2025 at Metropolis Theater in Berlin (GER)
mainWorks.description: “Work in Progress” Premiered at performed at Hoffestspiele (GER) 2025 BERLIN

mainWorks.title: The Straight Path
mainWorks.subtitle: 2025 - Video Performance
mainWorks.description: The Straight Path follows a lone dancer navigating the labyrinthine streets of Tunis where the promised simplicity of a straight path dissolves into a dance of setbacks and struggle. In his relentless journey, the dance wryly exposes the tangled, unpredictable nature of life each misstep, trip, and spin echoes life’s defiance against smooth journeys, reflecting the harsh reality behind all promises of easy success and divine guidance..

mainWorks.title: Unlocked
mainWorks.subtitle: 2024 2025 - Dance Solo
mainWorks.description:
Unlocked is a solo dance piece, based on a 29 year body record of strong emotional experiences that shaped the body to express itself in this way.

What is the meaning of this body in movement?

How much do these emotional experiences shape the body and influence its expression through movement?

The dance piece tells an inner journey where the memory of the body navigates to past states of rage and despair. It's not about seeking to be overshadowed by the weight of trauma. On the contrary, the performer aims to shed light on the triumphs and successes that emerge from the human body's capacity to heal and overcome adversity through dance.
mainWorks.premiered: PREMIERED AT EXPEDITION METROPOLIS THEATER BERLIN (2024)

mainWorks.title: SCHAF IM WOLFSPELZ
mainWorks.subtitle: 2019 2024 - Dance Performance
mainWorks.description: Born into a world of madness, a world of insane wars, unleashed by the reaction of crazy people to their anger and fear. How do we face different realities in the same situation we live in? The performance is about stereotypical thinking and nervous convulsions. Being forced into a role and at the same time finding strategies to survive this madness. It's about my reality and your reality. What happens when your world is turned upside down?
mainWorks.premiered: PERFORMED at KULTURSOMMER WIEN (AUS) 2024, AT THEATER FORUM KREUZBERG BERLIN (2019), THEATER HAUS MITTE BERLIN (2019), THEATER EXPEDITION METROPOLIS BERLIN (2019), CYRCUS MOND BERLIN (2019) and SUMMER INTENSIVE FESTIVAL LISBOA (2019)U

credits.name: JAN EISENHART, KARLOTTA FRANK, KEIVIN BENAVIDES, KIKI HAVEMANN, LUCIO SETA, PHILIPPE MARIANI DUCASSE AND ROCIO GOTTSCHALCK

mainWorks.title: Out Of Whack
mainWorks.subtitle: 2024 - Dance Performance
mainWorks.description: “OUT OF WHACK” is a medium-length dance performance that blends elements from urban, contemporary dance and theatre. Between pre-recorded soundscapes accompanying the choreography, the stage becomes a microcosm of modern society and manifests the tension between authority and autonomy. OUT OF WHACK aims to reveal stories of our bodies shaped by conformity and tradition but also as places of resistance and visceral self-expression.
mainWorks.premiered: PREMIERED AT HOFFESTSPIELE FESTIVAL EXPEDITION METROPOLIS, BERLIN (2024) SUPPORTED BY EXPEDITION METROPOLIS RESIDENCY PROGRAMME

credits.name: LUCIO SETA, KARLOTTA FRANK & JOHN SHADES

mainWorks.title: CLEO
mainWorks.subtitle: 2023 - Digital Dance Opera
mainWorks.description: Cleopatra, ruler from history, seductress in Handel's baroque opera Giulio Cesare, today a symbol of pop culture. Her story was filmed, told in comics and her style is copied - Beyoncé, Cardi B and Lizzo wear her headpieces, Uma Thurman a Cleopatra bob in Pulp Fiction. The ancient Egyptian queen is an oversized projection screen for clichés, cultural appropriation and empowerment. BERLIN MOVES explores this field of tension around the numerous Cleopatra art figures with artistic director and choreographer Lior Shneior, motion capture, and a team of programmers and 3D designers through dance and virtually. A journey from Egypt through pop culture into the eternity of the internet.

credits.name: LUCIO SETA, JOHN SHADES, MICHELLE KERN, CINZIA RUSSO, SERGIO GUERRA AND POLLY OTT

mainWorks.title: STATE OF JOINT
mainWorks.subtitle: 2022 - 2023 - 2024 - Duett Dance Performance
mainWorks.description: State of joint captures a biographical story and explores the bond dynamics between brother and sister. Bringing in elements of contemporary and urban dance, acrobatics-partnering and physical theater, the piece explores and depictures feelings of joy, companionship, loneliness and separateness in the context of a pandemic world crisis. Through different soundscapes and images we embody memories from our childhood, teenagehood until our current reality embracing dance as a powerful medium of expression and its potential to tell a story based on real events.
mainWorks.premiered: PREMIERED AT HOFFESTSPIELE FESTIVAL EXPEDITION METROPOLIS, BERLIN (2022); PERFORMED AT FRAGMENTOS MANDRIL THEATER BUENOS AIRES (2023); KULTURSOMMER WIEN, AUSTRIA (2023)

mainWorks.title: UPSTAIRS DOWNTOWN
mainWorks.subtitle: 2022 Dance Performance - Film - Live Music
mainWorks.description: Upstairs Downtown combines elements of urban dance (Hip Hop, House and Breakdance) with Tango. The performers in the daily routine of the city, yearn for connections in order to implement new encounters that lead to celebrate together dancing.
mainWorks.premiered: PREMIERED OUTDOOR AT PAUL LOBE HAUS BERLIN (2022)

credits.name: LUCIO SETA, ROSA DICUONZO, HANNA JACOBI, PAULINE HERTLING, SELENE TOGNOLI, AMARA THOMAS, SAMIRA AAKCHA
MORITZ ALBERT, ANNA KORN, ANNA KRUSE AND PASCAL JARCHOW

mainWorks.title: Quien Levanta la mano
mainWorks.subtitle: 2018 - 2019 Dance Performance
mainWorks.description: Who will raise their hand? is an urban dance program that mixes elements of modern dance, hip hop and parcours. The group has its very own style. It mixes urban dance forms with contemporary choreographies and sometimes indigenous rhythms. This allows them to escape the 'ghetto' cliché and create a completely new style. The dance becomes a kind of ritual that creates a bridge of connection and thus transcends differences in origin, skin color, clichés and socialization. It is about mobilizing the community to stand up and declare war on the injustice of the world!
mainWorks.premiered: PREMIERED AT CENTRO CULTURAL “CREAR VALE LA PENA” BUENOS AIRES (2018), CENTRO CULTURAL CONTI BUENOS AIRES (2019), and was part of the Kinder Kulture Karawane Tour in 2018, having performed in Berlin and 11 cities in Germany.

credits.name: EVELYN LOPEZ, ERIC BEAT, ZAYRA ARCE, JOHNATAN LOPEZ, LUCIO SETA, ROMINA SOSA AND MILAGROS ARMOA

otherWorks.subtitle: Official Video Clip

otherWorks.title: En Nombre del Viaje
otherWorks.subtitle: 2024 - Short film
otherWorks.description:
The name of the journey speaks about migration and one's own land. About the resignifcation of space and the others, who confirm that the space is worth only because we fill it together.

The plot is immersed in the point of view of the one who left, and does not know when to return. It is a short film that suffers the uprooting beyond the privilege of being able to leave. The guilt of leaving those who grow old elsewhere and the pressure to grow up invade the light of the week, while Manu understands a possible path towards something that is still unknown to him, but familiar. And, thus, he approaches that which moved him in some past time.

Does it still belong?

otherWorks.title: Sensing Volumes
otherWorks.subtitle: 2023 - Dance & Sound Workshop and Performance
otherWorks.description:
The SENSING VOLUMES project includes an interactive installation where participants can explore their senses, as well as three one-hour-long performances where a solo dancer engages with the installation and showcases its potential. The installation is designed to translate body movement on stage into sound, as well as sound into real-time lighting and visuals.This helps the audience to experience the performance as a whole, giving multiple pathways for exploring and participating in the work, despite any impairments or preferences across the senses.

A big textile sculpture made of ropes will be an analog complement to the digital installation and can be moved and transformed by the audience. These elements provide a soft, tactile experience, inviting to take time and observe the overall playground.

The artists are designing performances, installations and workshops where sound, visual and movement become part of the same vocabulary.
otherWorks.premiered: PERFORMED AT UFER STUDIOS STUDIO 1 BERLIN (2023)
